tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you an engaging mix of the latest news, information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Eat The Invaders
programme.desc: Tony Armstrong visits ground zero of the rabbit invasion, exploring why Australia abandoned a beloved cuisine and considers putting underground mutton back on the national menu.

programme.title: Compass
programme.sub-title: Stan Grant On Country with Indira Naidoo
programme.desc: Indira Naidoo in conversation with Stan Grant, exploring his deepening faith, Indigenous spirituality, his response to the Voice referendum, and the pivotal relationship with his father, a Wiradjuri elder.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Summer: South Asian Crops and Butterfly World
programme.desc: Costa meets a farmer growing South Asian crops, Sophie strolls through a garden symphony at a concert hall, Clarence finds natives thriving on a steep slope, and Millie discovers the fascinating life of butterflies. (Final)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two shocking discoveries of missing siblings; Steve Austin and Moira Tonge are brother and sister who discover they have an older sister, and Lisa Irvine also only found out about her brother Nicholas as an adult.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Richard and Erin Sims start out building a farm-style lodge, however it balloons into a building of epic proportions, complete with three wings, seven-metre-high chimneys, and thousands of hand-picked dolerite stones.

programme.title: Portrait Artist Of The Year
programme.desc: In the final heat, nine artists from across Australia have just four hours to create portraits of Muster Dogs Season 1 winner Frank Finger and his dog Annie, actor Chloe Hayden and comedian Alex Lee.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Getting into the Christmas spirit, Nigella shares her foolproof guide to stress-free festive cooking and easy entertaining - with a line-up of celebratory dishes which are both indulgent and practical.

programme.title: Dream Gardens
programme.desc: Stewart and Sandra lost their home and garden in the devastating 2009 Black Saturday bushfires. Now its time to start again with a spectacular new garden designed by one of Australias most well-known designers, Paul Bangay.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the body of a missing trawler man is pulled from the sea, DCI Vera Stanhope must delve into the lives of his family in a close knit fishing community.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a young popstar is found dead at a rehab clinic, it initially looks like a tragic accident. But Neville is convinced theres more to her death than meets the eye.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: The Settlers
programme.desc: In the occupied territory of the West Bank is a growing ultra-nationalist community of Israeli settlers. Louis meets prominent settlers and discovers the consequences of their activity - and their plans to move into Gaza.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Blossom gets overzealous with spring cleaning.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Sharon Van Etten and The Attachment Theory
programme.desc: Join Sharon Van Etten and her band The Attachment Theory as they guest program rage, bringing their signature mix of power and tenderness to the red couch.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors make Billy Bones his very own bum and reveal the power of your gluteus maximus muscle! And find out who gets snotted in Ouchology.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: When pests swarm a party, Jedi jump in to help.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun goes extra Christmassy for the background of the Farmers Christmas card photo by secretly knitting festive jumpers to brighten it up.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Today there are record breaking attempts from a real life ninja, as well as a street basketball player and a kayaking superstar.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: BTN High breaks down the weeks biggest news stories for Aussie high schoolers.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When the director of a new film inspired by Ladybug and Chat Noir gets neglected and put-down at his premiere, he turns into Animaestro, who wants to show the world what directors are really made of.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A friend of Adriens gets akumatized into Lies. Able to make liars disappear, she is determined to rid the world of lies and those who tell them... including superheroes!

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: When a beautiful dress arrives at Malory Towers, the girls are buzzing to realise there is a debutante in their midst, but who is it?

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun is in serious trouble when the Farmer discovers hes the cake thief whos sabotaged his baked goods. When another farmer arrives and begins negotiations with the Farmer, Shaun fears the worst.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Newsflash just in... a super gross stink has been detected coming from the vicinity of the Doctors lab. The hunt is on for grossest thing on Operation Ouch!...ever!

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: This instalment of the Crystal Maze sees DJ Melvin Odoom captain comedian All Murray, actor Kara Tointon, reality TV stalwart Olivia Attwood and actor Ashley Taylor-Dawson through the ubiquitous 4 zones.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug faces her own grandfather. Now Bakerix, he wants to destroy everything he deems too modern and go back to the Paris he used to know.

programme.title: rage Good Things Lineup Special
programme.desc: From Weezer to Tool, Garbage, Refused and more, rage lines up the best clips from this years Good Things line-up.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and the last day of term at Malory Towers. Everyone is excited! Darrell is disappointed that her parents have been delayed due to bad weather and that shell have to stay at school for Christmas.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: The Moomin familys hospitality is endangered as Mymble moves in with her children.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nash and the droids pursue a stolen ship part.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phils on the Wirral, on a mission to tackle a five bed semi that looks more like a student hall of residence than a home. He also visits Marsden, West Yorkshire, to help bring a house out of past and into the present day.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Selling Sex
programme.desc: The exchange of sex for money is legal in Britain, so long as it doesnt involve coercion, exploitation, or any kind of public nuisance. Now, fuelled by websites and social media, a new economy has emerged.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: A Place For Paedophiles
programme.desc: Louis Theroux meets patients and therapists at Californias Coalinga Mental Hospital which houses more than 500 convicted paedophiles.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Andrew, a new kid at Hartley who has muscular dystrophy, is determined to fit in

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintroll waits for his best friend to arrive to the valley, but he has to be patient as Snufkin takes his time.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: A villain sets off a backwards bubble that causes everyone at headquarters to move backwards.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Nom Nom recruits the Bears to act as his entourage of friends. But when the Bears realise Nom Nom doesnt understand friendship, they decide to kick their day of bonding into high gear.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Pinkie Pie visits Prince Rutherford and the Yaks. While there an avalanche falls on the entire rustic village of Yakyakistan. Pinkie Pie suggests that she go to get the other ponies to come help.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven thinks his favorite ice cream sandwiches are the trick to summoning his magic shield but learns otherwise when facing off with an acid-spewing insect monster.

programme.title: George Clarkes Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Paul and Imogen snapped up a collection of abandoned buildings, including a pub, butchers and bakery. With ambitious plans to restore the Grade II listed building, there are long delays and eye-watering costs.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Alexandra, Artem, Anthony Dempsey and Rune Carlsen.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.sub-title: Ask Me No Questions, Ill Tell You No Lies
programme.desc: Section D are back, tracking a Somalian terrorist on a boat carrying a lethal load. The team suspect the felon and his cargo are bound for Plymouth - just in time for launch of the new Royal Navy vessel.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.sub-title: Lys And The Snowy Mountain Rescue
programme.desc: The younglings help wrangle creatures.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The children are at the Elf Farm, but to learn where milk comes from they must visit a Big Farm, to find cows. They travel to Lucy Bigs Farm, where she shows them all the animals.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The man is packing his suitcase ready for a holiday. He stretches his goggles and swimming trunks before placing them in the suitcase. The Twirlywoos have a go at stretching too, what will the man wear to go swimming in now?

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel and Miss Elaina are so excited to visit Ducky at the Neighborhood farm, but when they arrive, she isnt there!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Coco are drawing Gilly a picture, but when Bing goes to say hello, Charlie does a big squiggle on Bings drawing! Gilly shows them a game called "Squiggling!"

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George notice they have shadows, and no matter how fast they walk, run, or jump - they cant lose them.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Judy does not like violin lessons so she hides from Ms Potts. Paddington takes up the challenge. Watch out, ears!

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora and her vampire cousin, Amma are trying to learn a V Pop dance.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: After Dad eats her last chip, Bingo is given three chances to put Mum and Dad in Dance Mode as payback. But the others cant resist taking Bingos turns for her.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Silver Paw plots to throw Dads red underwear in the wash to turn Scarletts soccer uniform pink. Jeremy must confront his fear of heights in a nail-biting high-wire clothesline crossing.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds meet the cutest kittens and discover the super powers of our furry friends! Cats come in many colors and sizes, and all kinds of beautiful fur. But check this out - some dont have any fur at all!

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: When a hat machine malfunctions and it starts raining silly hats on Pretty Big City, the Mechas need to act fast!

programme.title: Super Monsters Save Christmas
programme.desc: The Super Monsters save Christmas by working together to restore cheer and help Santa deliver holiday joy to Pitchfork Pines.

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.sub-title: Elmo Goes Down The Big Slide
programme.desc: Elmo is feeling excited and a little scared to go down the big slide for the very first time. Chris helps Elmo by holding his hand as he goes down the slide. Elmo doesnt feel scared anymore!

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: The band accidentally shutdown the BBC but come to the rescue by presenting all the shows.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today Peppa is making a quilt for the new addition to the family. Together with Mummy Pig and Granny Pig, they collect old fabric and create a beautiful quilt embellished with memories.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes discover a new game - Pea-Rex Pinball! Its all fun and games until they suddenly find themselves cornered by a horde of super irritated Vegesaurs.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When Drews dance partner is unable to perform at the school talent show, the Dream Factory Crew equips Jonathan with programmed dancing shoes to act as a replacement. But the shoes go haywire!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts follow a strange song to a lonely humpback whale, who is alone because he doesnt sound like the other whales!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy is looking after James and Sarahs guinea pig, Norris. But when Norris escapes, in the ensuing chaos, Mandy accidentally starts a fire.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Silver Paw tries to fly to the moon in a bottle rocket. / Jeremy and Deena need to sneak into the playroom and shut down Glitchs Noise Maker.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Luca learn the importance of water when gardening and make a portable water lily pond.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is World Book Day at playgroup but Peppa has so many favourite books she just cannot decide which to go as.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of Old Browns New Roost
programme.desc: When Old Brown quits Owl Island in search of some peace and quiet, his new roost turns out to be a little too close to home for Peter, Lily and Benjamin!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Tweak, Paani and Dashi work with a team of fire ants to engineer an escape route when the Paraguay river floods the ants home.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Mum and Dad describe a made-up world where they can relax without the girls, Bluey and Bingo decide to burst into their fantasy and chase them down. How will Mum and Dad escape?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is using his trusty binoculars to do some bird-watching, and of course, the squirrels want to have a go too. The problem is, if you want to go bird watching you have to be very quiet otherwise the birds will fly away.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: The Piris hike to Tippety Top to see the Southern lights but must brave an ice-fog.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai causes problems when he attempts to program droids to clean the temple.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Queen Thistle decides to take a day off, so Holly, Ben, Nanny and the King have to look after the naughty twins Daisy and Poppy for the day. But even all the Elves in the Little Kingdom cant help them stay out of trouble.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos are watching a man flying his model aeroplane, and watch it coming and going as it flies overhead.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel wants to play a game with Mum Tiger outside, hes upset that she is giving Margaret all of her attention.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bings sleeping at Sulas but has forgotten Hoppity! A scratchy branch terrifies Bing, whos not comforted by Sulas Fairy Rhino! Sula, Nicky and Bing play Nicky tickles as they wait for Flop.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is International Day at playgroup and Peppa and her friends have dressed up as countries of the world.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington does not have a hobby; the Browns all seem to be good at something, buts hes not. Mrs Brown finds out what Paddington is good at in the end.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Three baby ladybirds, Amber, Emerald and Keith have come to stay at their uncle Gastons for the day. The baby ladybirds are exhausting! So Ben and Holly help Gaston to keep them entertained.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family are on the search for a new home but after all the house viewings, nothing beats their home. Peppa then suggests they extend their house instead, so the family design a bigger house together.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma cant wait to explore on Snorkelling Day, but her snorkel gets in the way. Frizzy is being distracting while the cadets learn how to stay calm in the water, but in the end, its Frizzy who teaches Gemma how to relax.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Its been one year since Cosima crash-landed on Proxima, but no one else has remembered this anniversary! Can a perfect picnic jolt their memories?

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: Rise and shine, its time for breakfast! Leah and Matt are joined by cook and food educator Alice Zaslavsky for a brilliant breakfast of zucchini fritters and homemade granola with yoghurt and blueberries.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups take a trip to space for a cheesy bite to eat. The orders pile up for the Lucky Loover Bird chef, will the Mixmups have the patience to wait for their food or will they have to find another way to hurry things up?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is busy building a tower as tall as he is with his blocks and is upset when Coco arrives and hijacks the blocks so that she can make a rainbow pattern with them instead.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: With only five minutes to play Driving, Bluey and Mum race against the clock to buy milk for a grumpy guest and have to escape an angry shopkeeper.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Find out how Mister Maker creates waves on an Australian beach, cooks up a tasty surprise - with a twist - in the UK, and see whether he can make sensational Spoon Maracas in under a minute on a trip to South Africa!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: While repairing a sea wall, Sandy and Carly accidentally cut off a consortium of crabs from the shore! When the crabs start to wreak havoc among the farm animals, Carly and Sandy work together to wrangle the crabs.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is World Book Day at playgroup but Peppa has so many favourite books she just cannot decide which to go as.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes search for honeysuckles, leaving behind a trail of berries to help find their way back. But when Wasabi eats the trail, theyre stranded in the dark!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Its an epic game of "Find the Flag" - and the winner gets to open the mystery box of presents that Drew and Jonathans mom brought back from her business trip.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: While exploring a dark and spooky cave, the Octonauts discover the fossil of a powerful, prehistoric fish... but it may be more than just a fossil.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Pioneers work on Annies farm, but Sarah accidentally lets the sheep go loose. They knock over Annies stove which starts a fire.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is in Sydney city, taking in the amazing sights and the majestic ibis! Michelle and Kaeng build an underground train to help people get around, and Michelle sings and dances with Kaeng the busker!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Mummy and Daddy go on a trip to the childrens festival where there is singing, making crafts and listening to stories. They stay overnight in a tent, though it looks like its going to rain.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: A strange find far away from the ship breaks D.O.R.I.S.s sat nav. Luckily, Big Lizards on hand to teach Cosima how to find her way around without technology.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets are planning an epic surprise pool party for Phillipas birthday but when things get out of hand, they forget the golden pool rule: keep the gate shut.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Owlette accidentally helps Pirate Robot attack the Flying factory.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee introduces the squirrels to his friend Eugene, the leader of the Big Parade. Poor Eugene has lost his hat. Dont worry Eugene, the squirrels will find you a new hat in their dressing up box.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Carrot are in a race to find treasure before Captain Pak Choi does

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Fiona Willan.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 2019 - Ben Stokes incredible escape at Headingley
programme.desc: Jim Maxwell looks back on his favourite Ashes moments from his time following the game. In 4th spot, Jim and Corbin Middlemas reflect on Ben Stokes masterful innings in 2019 that secured England a famous win at Headingley.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The barge ferrying cattle over the flooded Cooper Creek on the Birdsville Track; plus a luxurious new paddle steamer makes an 800km journey up the Murray River. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Fiona Willan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Catherine, Nate and Steph Ferrier hear from Paul Mescal and Josh OConnor about their film The History of Sound plus Zak Hepburn, Casey Donovan and Chocolate Queen Kirsten Tibballs with a seasonal showstopper.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: We surveyed Australians under 16 about the federal governments social media ban: whether it will work, what platforms they use, and if the ban will actually change their behaviour. 17,000 responses later, the results are in.

programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special
programme.desc: In this Summer Special of The Pacific: we investigate the scale of illegal fishing across the region and the toll its taking on Pacific nations. Plus we explore how growing militarisation in Palau is reshaping daily life.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Amy Culpitt presents the weeks regional news: Farmers warn of a growing risk amid record breaking harvests; From feast to famine: the market swing making egg farming tricky; and Christmas comes early in one remote community.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you an engaging mix of the latest news, information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you an engaging mix of the latest news, information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Play On
programme.desc: Connor OLeary, a Cronulla surfer who now surfs for Japan. Pasifika rugby league players on their connection to their homeland. And Gronya Somerville, a badminton player exploring her ties to Chinese aristocracy.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Why rate cuts are off the table as Australias growing economy hits the speed limit. Plus its the small capitals leading the price charge - the prediction for record home values in the New Year. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Your Say: Digital Dilemma
programme.desc: How Australians access social media is about to change due to tougher new laws designed to protect under 16s. Rafael Epstein and Ange Lavoipierre lead a panel of experts to answer questions from the audience. (Recorded Oct)

programme.title: BTN: Teen Social Media Ban Special
programme.desc: Australia is about to become the first country in the world to ban social media for kids under 16. In this BTN Special, kids question PM Anthony Albanese about the ban and we ask teens what they think.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.desc: The voice of summer, ABC cricket commentator Jim Maxwell reflects on his six favourite Ashes moments, starting with the incident between Jonny Bairstow and Alex Carey at Lords in 2023 when Bairstow was stumped.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Its been 50 years since the dismissal of the Whitlam government. We look back at why it happened and how its still influencing Australian politics today.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Melissa Mackay brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Melissa Mackay brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Disconnected: The Teen Social Media Ban
programme.desc: As Australia begins to restrict access for under 16s to social media platforms, we ask teens and experts about the move being closely watched by big tech giants, platforms and countries grappling with the use of data.
